name: Check equipment and nameplate details are correct and in accordance with the data sheet and Equipment Schedule.
No mechanical damage and paintwork in good condition.
Operation of emergency lighting fixtures checked
Mounting arrangement and degree unit is installed is correct
External cabling is correctly installed and labelled.
Battery run-down test per manufacturers specification
Power / load balance on distribution board checked
Operation of remote lighting control checked
All spare entries blanked off with correct plugs.
Check item is suitably rated for area (E.g. IP rating, Ex rating)
Insulation resistance of final sub-circuits checked
Operation of photo-electric cell control checked
Circuit ID fitted to all light switches
All switching tested and confirmed as correct (two way, intermediate, on/off/auto etc
Lux levels meet minimum client specifications (Closed door and measure lux level at darkest point of personnel accessible area)
Add applicable signatures (e.g Electrician, Inspector, Client Representative)
Check equipment and nameplate details are correct and in accordance with the data sheet and equipment schedule.
Check holding down/mounting arrangement is correct.
Confirm that all temporary supports, jumpers and ties have been removed.
Incoming cables correctly installed, terminated and supported.
Confirm that padlocking facilities are provided and operate correctly allowing all circuit breakers to be locked in the open position and safety shutters locked in the closed position.
Confirm all cubicle doors can be opened without obstruction and minimum required clearances are retained
Bus bar terminations tightened to specified torque
Confirm components, fuses etc. correctly sized and identified as per design drawings and Single Line Diagrams.
Instruments, indication lamps and interlocks correct.
Ammeter and current transformer correctly installed.
Check that Switchboard is correctly earthed.  Check door, escutcheon, gland plate, gland and frame.
Test and confirm the earth resistance between switchboard and local earth system is less than 0.5ohms
All internal cabling and wiring neat, correct, and undamaged.
Confirm that all insulating bushings and barriers are satisfactory.
Check Busbar insulation resistance between earth and phases. For a duration of 60 seconds with the following voltages.
System KV || Test V (dc) || Min IR Reading
Add applicable signatures (e.g Electrician, Inspector, Client Representative)
Check entire Bus Bar and confirm there is no damage
Verify zone bus-bar is rated for
Please attatch photo of Bus Bar
Confirm all jointing bolts are present and have been torque tested in accordance with the manufacturer and design requirements.
Confirm all transit packing and preservation materials have been removed.
Confirm Bus Bar clearances conform to manufactures and design requirements.
Confirm all Bus Bars are secure within the supports.
Record the total number of bus bar joints.
Add applicable signatures (e.g Electrician, Inspector, Client Representative)
Verify cable type, size, colour code and tags are in accordance with the Cable Schedule.
Cable terminated with correct lugs and crimped with the correct die.
Confirm spare cores and shields are terminated and conform to drawings and client spec.
Record test results: Insulation Resistance, Continuity, Bonding, Other.

ITR-I-01 Fire and Gas Detection Alarms
Component & Type / Model correct per equipment schedule
Installation free of mechanical damage and clean
Glanding correct and spare entries plugged with correctly rated plug
All relevant signatures (Installed by, Approved by, Client Representative)
Check equipment and nameplate details are correct and in accordance with the data sheet and Equipment Schedule.
Holding down arrangement and seat alignment correct.
Main switches, contactors, fuses etc. sized & identified correctly as per Single Line Drawings.
Check Main Isolator and Bypass switch operation
Check manual operation of selector switch, MCB, push button, etc.
Incoming cable correctly installed, terminated & supported.
All internal cabling & wiring neat, correct & tight. Unused cable entries sealed.
Drawings marked up with relevant changes and As-builts complete.
Earth Continuity, Insulation Resistance, Temperature, Phase Rotation, Polarity.
